title: Abode
tip: A realm created by the adepti. Abodes have their own rules and logic, and are in some ways no different from pocket dimensions.

title: Adventurers' Guild
tip: The Adventurers' Guild is active all across Teyvat, exploring lands full of mystery and secrets. Even a great cavern filled with unknown perils like The Chasm will not daunt them.Even if they will pay a heavy price for their deeds, they will press onward. This is the spirit of the adventurer!

title: Adventurers' Guild
tip: The Ministry of Civil Affairs will sometimes hire some adventurers to perform exploratory and cartographic work for Liyue.

title: Amber
tip: Organic, crystalline formations known as Amber can be found on Mt. Hulao in Jueyun Karst. Who knows what treasures may be found within them?

title: Azhdaha
tip: A great dragon of rock that once wreaked havoc in olden times is sealed within the depths of the earth at Nantianmen...

title: City Reputation
tip: Once you have gained enough Reputation and won the trust of Liyue's people, some merchants may be willing to give you discounts.

title: City Reputation
tip: Liyue is the beating heart of commerce and mercantile activity. If you can earn Ms. Yu's trust, perhaps she might grant you access to priceless and otherwise unobtainable recipes...

title: City Reputation: Bounties
tip: Perilous creatures will sometimes emerge and menace the outskirts of Liyue. Ms. Yu from the Ministry of Civil Affairs pays attention to rumors of such monsters, recording and investigating each one with care. Once you Reputation reaches a certain level, you will be able to view these monster bounties.

title: City Reputation: Requests
tip: Meeting the needs of Liyue's people is the sworn duty of the Ministry of Civil Affairs. But there is a limit to just how much people can do, and tasks have been piling up at Ms. Yu's desk. Once your Reputation reaches a certain level, you will gain access to Liyue's requests. Solving people's problems will surely raise your standing with them, right?

title: Cocogoat
tip: The legendary adeptibeast.

title: Cooking
tip: Wanmin Restaurant of Chihu Rock is a favorite of food lovers. They also offer food to take away and sell cooking ingredients, so travelers and adventurers love it too.

title: Dark Mud
tip: A mysterious poisonous substance bursts forth from rifts underground. It has a lethal effect on any life it touches. But when some monsters are within this sludge, they become stronger and more powerful...

title: Dark Mud
tip: A mysterious substance that can contaminate the ground and have ill-effects on humans. Of these, the Oozing Concretions can only be destroyed via the application of Blooming Light from a Lumenstone Adjuvant.

title: Dark Mud
tip: The Oozing Concretions are the core of the dark mud. Destroying them is thus key to dispelling the threat of the mud. However, Concretions resistant to such attempts also exist.

title: Elemental Sigils
tip: Geo Sigils are found throughout the vast land of Liyue as a reward for finding treasure and completing challenges. You might find someone in Liyue Harbor who offers rare treasures in return for them.

title: Fatui
tip: The Fatui are also at work here within The Chasm. Due to their contact with the surface having been cut off, they don't seem to be aware of what happened outside at all...

title: Fishing
tip: Jiawei of Liyue Harbor knows quite a lot about fishing and is happy to share some of his fishing supplies with people who share his interests.

title: Forging
tip: Liyue is home to a time-honored smithy called Hanfeng's Ironmongers. The craft has been passed down for generations and quality is guaranteed. Your ore and prototypes will be safe in the hands of Master Zhang.

title: Geograna
tip: In the wild, you may come across oddly-shaped crystals in which live Geograna. These curious Geo beings will follow you around. Take one near a certain lamp-shaped object and see what happens...

title: Geovishap
tip: A vishap that dwells amidst the mountain and that has a rock-hard carapace. After many years have passed, Geovishap Hatchlings will shed the armor that originally protected them and become mature Geovishaps.

title: Geovishap
tip: Geovishaps that have survived for many years and have accumulated vast amounts of power will become Primo Geovishaps.

title: Infusion Stones
tip: There's legend of a strange stone in Liyue infused with incredible elemental energy that even affects nearby monsters with elemental affixes. If you wait too long to destroy these Infusion Stones, the monsters will become more and more dangerous...

title: Liyue
tip: A bountiful harbor that lies in the East. Mountains stand tall and proud alongside the stone forest, that together with the open plains and flowing rivers make up Liyue's breathtaking landscape.

title: Liyue
tip: Liyue is dotted with ancient ruins. One of these is the monumental Guizhong Ballista, which was constructed using highly advanced engineering skills.

title: Liyue Harbor
tip: A harbor city built from the ground up by Rex Lapis, known all over as a wealthy trading hub. "Where merchants flock and all ships dock, and over the oceans flows its stock."

title: Lumenstone
tip: A mysterious ore that can only be found underground in The Chasm.

title: Lumenstone
tip: A marvelous ore found specifically within The Chasm. It only exists within the dark underground tunnels. It has the wondrous power to store energy and release light.

title: Lumenstone Adjuvant
tip: An object with catalytic properties created from Lumenstone Ore. When in the Underground Mines, this Adjuvant can produce light, bringing a small amount of comfort to an otherwise dreary trek.

title: Lumenstone Adjuvant
tip: An adjuvant made from processed Lumenstone ore. When refined and enhanced up to a certain point, it can release its stored energy and destroy nearby Oozing Concretions.

title: Lumenstone Adjuvant
tip: An adjuvant made from refined Lumenstone ore. It can store energy and emit light. Some of its energy can also be used to activate some mysterious devices.

title: Lumenstone Adjuvant
tip: An adjuvant made from refined Lumenstone ore. It can store energy and emit light. The amount of energy it can store is intimately related to its enhancement level.

title: Millelith
tip: While the Millelith stands guard, evil shall never prevail! Their main duty is to keep the peace in Liyue.

title: Ministry of Civil Affairs Specialist
tip: The Ministry of Civil Affairs has specifically sent this person to The Chasm. Their main duties are to maintain the sealed state of The Chasm and to make sure that supplies reach those staffing the area.

title: Qixing
tip: The elite few who govern the land of Liyue.

title: Seelie
tip: The Chasm's unique climate has caused even the Seelie to mutate. Being close to a Luminous Seelie will gradually recharge the Lumenstone Adjuvant's energy. The light from such a Seelie can also activate some devices

title: Serenitea Pot
tip: Adepti use Serenitea Pots as media through which they can channel their adeptal power and create realms and abodes.

title: Seven-Star Array
tip: As the name suggests, this arcane formation was laid down by the Liyue Qixing. This authority may not be gainsaid, nor are its Bedrock Keys anything if not unbreakable.

title: Shroom-Kin
tip: A giant mushroom guided by a mysterious light at the bottom of The Chasm to gain intelligence. It believes itself to have a great sense of humor.

title: Shroom-Kin
tip: It is said that Xamaran was a name it took up from an old friend in Sumeru.

title: Spoutrock
tip: A rock with strange physical properties that can store high-pressure air. Be wary when walking above them, as they might release a gout of pressurized air at any moment.

title: The Chasm
tip: As Liyue's main mine, The Chasm has actually never completely ceased to be used. Although most of the miners were indeed dispersed, a small number of specially-authorized professional miners are still working here in case of any emergencies.

title: The Chasm
tip: As Liyue's major mining site, the situation at The Chasm is constantly under Yujing Terrace's scrutiny. Smuggling and theft will be swiftly dealt with by the Millelith.

title: The Chasm
tip: It is said that an inverted city is situated somewhere deep within The Chasm...

title: The Chasm
tip: Many bandits and adventurers have dug all manner of secret paths through the mines.

title: The Chasm
tip: The bizarre crystals within The Chasm have many names, one of which is "Wishstone." Some superstitious miners believe that through certain strange methods, they can help make otherwise impossible wishes come true.

title: The Chasm
tip: The surface of this area is dotted with some strangely-shaped rock pillars. They will resonate when they are hit hard. Whether this resonance will trigger any other interesting phenomena or not remains to be seen. Regardless, such behavior seems inappropriate insofar as mine safety measures or Liyue's folk beliefs are concerned.

title: The Chasm
tip: The surface of this area is dotted with some strangely-shaped rock pillars. The miners say that these are holy relics left behind by an ancient battle the Lord of Geo fought there.

title: The Chasm
tip: The surface of this area is dotted with some strangely-shaped rock pillars. The miners say that these are holy relics left behind by an ancient battle the Lord of Geo fought there. They will resonate when they receive significant impact. Whether this resonance will trigger any other interesting phenomena or not remains to be seen.

title: The Chasm
tip: There are some devices within The Chasm's depths that yearn for light. Some can be lit up by the Lumenstone Adjuvant, and some require the consumption of the energy stored within it.

title: The Chasm
tip: Poisonous gases sometimes leak within underground mines. This is why the miners bring finches underground with them.

title: The Chasm
tip: Some poisonous gases that leak out within underground mines will explode when they make contact with fire. This is why no one lights fires within mines and use crystal lamps instead.

title: The Chasm
tip: The stony halls of The Chasm's depths are the battleground for two powers that surpass this world...

title: The Chasm
tip: The people of Liyue believe that a Yaksha now sleeps eternally beneath The Chasm due to a battle against the dark calamity that occurred five hundred years ago...

title: The Chasm Exploration Team
tip: A team of people with various skillsets invited by Muning, with funding from Khedive. Their main purpose is to delve into The Chasm and collect data on the Ley Line movements there.

title: The Yakshas
tip: "Yakshas are illuminated beasts of Liyue, mighty and fierce in battle, killing in defense of order."

title: The Yakshas
tip: "Though they possessed great might, they could not escape the karma of their actions, becoming contaminated by lingering grudges."

title: Wangsheng Funeral Parlor
tip: Due to the unique nature of their line of work, they accept commissions via wooden tiles left at their front door. Allegedly, some of these tiles have "Buy one get one free for the holder of this tile" written on them...

title: Wangshu Inn
tip: An inn that overlooks the Dihua Marsh and the Guili Plains. You could well miss it if you set out from Mondstadt and follow the main road to Liyue Harbor.

title: Weasel Thief
tip: Small creatures captured and trained by the Treasure Hoarders, perhaps to help steal more treasure. But from the contents of their bags, it seems like they have nicked some loose change, at best.
